name: religiosity
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the quality of being very or too religious, or reminding you of religious behaviour, often in a way that is annoying: From his mother he inherited a fervent religiosity. She has a distaste for overt religiosity in public life. See
religiose
More examplesFewer examplesThe crisis has helped fuel the increasing religiosity in the country.Some of the patients on the ward exhibited extreme religiosity.Some of the lyrics of her songs reflect a deep religiosity.
